definition: to hinder the eyesight/(fig.) to trick into not noticing/to blindfold
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Master, Don't trust that ape. The brother monkey is deliberately trying to trick you by magic way.
sentences.chinese: 師傅不要信那猴頭，這是猴哥使的障眼法來騙您的。

sentences.english: I would ask you to believe that such an enchantment took place in its time.
sentences.chinese: 我想要你們相信，這種障眼畫法在當時盛行。

sentences.english: The drug war is a smokescreen for the real agenda.
sentences.chinese: 毒品戰爭不過是真正意圖的障眼法罷了。

sentences.english: I think the best head fake of all time comes from Caitlin Kelleher.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲有史以來最好的障眼法是來自凱特琳。

sentences.english: The mars business is just a deception.
sentences.chinese: 登陸火星只是中國的障眼法。

sentences.english: Master, don't believe that monkey, He's treating.
sentences.chinese: 師傅不要信那猴頭，這是猴哥使的障眼法來騙您的。

sentences.english: This situation is merely a defense to hide the gift.
sentences.chinese: 災難不過是個障眼物，爲的是要隱藏那個禮物。

definition: to bewitch/to enchant/to cast a spell over sb
a diversion/a feint attack to mislead the enemy
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
